books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: A novel set in the American South during the 1930s, addressing themes of racial injustice and moral growth.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian regime, exploring themes of surveillance, government oppression, and individualism.

books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: A novel set in the Roaring Twenties, depicting the decadence and moral ambiguity of the American upper class.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: A romantic novel set in Georgian England, revolving around the lives of the Bennet sisters and their suitors.

books.title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
books.author: J.K. Rowling
books.description: The first book in the Harry Potter series, following the journey of a young wizard, Harry Potter, as he attends Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: A novel narrated by Holden Caulfield, a disaffected teenager, who wanders through New York City while reflecting on his life and experiences.

books.title: Moby-Dick
books.author: Herman Melville
books.description: A novel following the journey of the narrator, Ishmael, and his obsessive quest for revenge against the elusive white whale, Moby Dick.

books.title: The Hobbit
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: A fantasy novel following the adventures of Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit who embarks on a quest to reclaim the Lonely Mountain and its treasure from the dragon Smaug.
